intro: Dudleya abramsii subsp. bettinae, commonly known as Betts' Dudleya, is a succulent plant native to California. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically blue-gray in color. The plant produces clusters of pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
